description.narrative: Key actors in decentralization and public finance reforms have increased capacities in programme budgeting, social accountability and advocacy to allocate more resources to social sectors and child-focused services., which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Children In Urban Settings / Local Governance, Evaluation And Research. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: The most marginalized children, adolescents and young people benefit from evidence-based social and economic policies and social protection programmes that address multidimensional poverty and advance the equitable realization of their rights.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Key actors in decentralization and public finance reforms have increased capacities in programme budgeting, social accountability and advocacy to allocate more resources to social sectors and child-focused services.

description.narrative: Two national benchmark studies on local governments' planning and local taxation underpin a process of capacity strengthening of local governments (LG)' and citizen participation in support of Niger's decentralization reform in social sectors, with interventions in 6 LGs to be piloted and evaluated during 2020. The process to strengthen budget transparency and accountability continued with the Ministry of Finance with the update of the BOOST database and training of key actors in 13 social ministries, parliamentarians, court of audit to analyse social sectors' budgets. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:02/02/2020

title.narrative: Number of municipalities where 100% of the members of inclusive communal consultation councils are adequately (> 80% post-tests) trained in participatory planning and budgeting processes with the direct UNICEF support
Number of municipalities with UNICEF-supported operational quality information system on the achievements of the municipality
Number of municipalities with an inclusive and functional UNICEF-supported accountability framework
Number of studies & programmes directors (DEP) from social ministries producing annual public expenditure
Number of social ministries' DPPD, PAP and RAP reports prepared according to standards (quality and timeliness) with UNICEF support.
